item.title: $7.3m base camp built for Afghan border police still empty after two months
item.description: A $7.3m (€5.4m) base camp built to house 175 Afghan Border Police was sitting virtually empty two months after it was handed over to Afghan authorities, and some equipment like wood-burning stoves had been dismantled, U.S. inspectors said.

item.title: Syria is being destroyed amid ‘unprecedented levels of horror’, warns envoy
item.description: SYRIA is "breaking up before everyone's eyes", a leading UN envoy has warned.

item.title: South Korea launches first rocket amid heightening tensions with North
item.description: SOUTH Korea launched its first space rocket carrying a science satellite amid heightened regional tensions, caused in part, by North Korea's successful launch of its own rocket last month.

item.title: Australian PM Gillard stuns voters by announcing September poll
item.description: AUSTRALIAN Prime Minister Julia Gillard set national elections for Sept. 14, stunning voters with eight months notice of the vote in a bold move designed to end political uncertainty surrounding her struggling minority government.

item.title: Israel to hand over $100m in withheld taxes to Palestinians
item.description: ISRAEL will give Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas's administration around $100m (€74m) in tax revenues that had been withheld in retaliation for his statehood bid in the United Nations.

item.title: 1913 nickel poised to make a mint
item.description: A humble five-cent coin with a mysterious past is heading to auction a century on, with bidding expected to top two million dollars.

item.title: Housework husbands 'have less sex'
item.description: Model husbands who cook, clean and generally help around the house may be missing out in bed, according to researchers.

item.title: Army chief warns Egypt on the road 'to collapse'
item.description: Egypt's army chief issued a bleak warning yesterday that the nationwide chaos in which 52 people have been killed is pushing the country to the brink of collapse.

item.title: Soldier who lost all four limbs 'gets life back'
item.description: AN American soldier who lost all his limbs in the Iraq war has undergone a double arm transplant which doctors say will eventually allow him to regain almost the full use of his hands.

item.title: Shooting from the lip, has Obama hit himself in foot?
item.description: BARACK Obama, pictured, has a well-documented history of shooting but, until now, it has involved "hoops" with his basketball buddies, the odd frame of pool and a round of golf.

item.title: Sarkozy 'colluded' to secure Qatar 2022 soccer World Cup
item.description: NICOLAS Sarkozy, the former French president, held a secret meeting in November 2010 which influenced the decision by football's governing body to award the 2022 football World Cup to Qatar, it was alleged yesterday.

item.title: Lollobrigida in action over fake wedding plot
item.description: It's not unknown for ageing divas of the silver screen to get hitched to men half their age. For an actress to marry a toyboy without appearing at the wedding, does seem rather peculiar, however.

item.title: Hollande left red-faced as minister calls French state 'bankrupt'
item.description: "France is totally bankrupt." The unexpected news came as a shock to most, but none more so than President Francois Hollande.

item.title: Australian PM's partner sorry for 'poor taste' joke
item.description: Australian prime minister Julia Gillard has been forced to apologise for a joke by partner Tim Mathieson about Asian women and prostate cancer.

item.title: 'Jobs' fruit diet leaves Kutcher in poor health
item.description: ASHTON Kutcher, who plays Steve Jobs in the biopic 'jOBS', has suffered from health problems after undertaking a fruit-only diet to prepare for the role.

item.title: 79 Syrian men and boys tied up, shot and dumped in river
item.description: THE bodies of at least 79 men and teenage boys, each with a single bullet hole to the head, were found in a river in Aleppo yesterday in the biggest mass murder of the country's two-year civil war.

item.title: Looters target Arab-owned shops in freed Timbuktu
item.description: CROWDS of looters rampaged from shop to shop, targeting those owned by ethnic Arabs in the newly liberated city of Timbuktu as troops struggled to maintain control a day after they were greeted as heroes.

item.title: Talk to the animals
item.description: Whether animals have language is the nature mystery people most want solved, according to a poll.

item.title: Horse DNA found in burgers being sold in Spain
item.description: THE horsemeat scandal widened further as horse DNA was discovered in Spanish burgers.

item.title: Coughing not music to ears for classic fans
item.description: CLASSICAL music fans regularly complain that their enjoyment of concerts is ruined by the hacking of other audience members. Now research has revealed that not only do people cough twice as much as normal during a classical concert – but many do it on purpose to show distaste for a performance.

item.title: Husbands who help with housework have less sex
item.description: HUSBANDS who stick to traditionally 'male' household jobs such as gardening and fixing the car have more sexual intercourse than men who helped their wives with 'female' tasks such as cooking, cleaning and shopping, research has suggested.

item.title: Billionaire Gates on mission to wipe out polio
item.description: BILL Gates claimed last night that polio could be eradicated worldwide by 2018. In a passionate speech on the need to reduce child mortality, the billionaire Microsoft founder and philanthropist set out his mission to rid the world of the disease and praised the British media for its role in highlighting issues of global poverty.

item.title: U.S. Senate votes to confirm Kerry as secretary of state
item.description: U.S. Senator John Kerry received enough Senate votes today to be confirmed as President Barack Obama's new secretary of state, succeeding Hillary Clinton.

item.title: Search on for stolen golden cookie
item.description: Police in Germany are hunting for a huge golden cookie, weighing around 44 pounds (20 kilograms).

item.title: ‘I’m getting a second chance’ - soldier who lost four limbs leaves hospital with transplant arms
item.description: A RETIRED U.S. Army sergeant who underwent a double arm transplant after losing both arms and both legs in Iraq was discharged from hospital.
